item.title: Splitting Lines in LaTeX Using Neovim
item.description: Dealing with LaTeX can be messy with paragraph-long lines, so I made a function to split and rejoin them.

Padavinangady Nakul Bhat

Hi There, I’m Nakul, a bioinformatics researcher who really, really loves typesetting.

item.title: Corpus Computatrum
item.description:
Spina - The Spine

  • NixOS – A declarative package manager with undeclared headaches.
  • Wayland – Display communication protocol that allows me to see my sh*tty code.
  • iwd – Network daemon for NetworkManager haters.
  • ly – TUI display manager. Fast. Too hacker-esque.
  • hyprsunset – Too lazy to find another blue-light filter.

Oculos - The Eyes

  • Waybar – Taskbar for anti-windows sentiments.
  • mako – Notification daemon for my failures.
  • tofi – Arch nemesis (lol) of The Start Menu. Faster than rofi and wofi if setup correctly.
  • grim – Screenshots on Wayland. High-school sweetheart of slurp.
  • slurp – Select a region on screen. High-school sweetheart of grim.
  • wl-clipboard – Ctrl + C; Ctrl + V.

Artus - The Limbs

  • Neovim – God’s code editor. Brought to you by the Temple of Vim.
  • Tree-sitter – Parser generator blah blah blah.
  • emmet-ls – Emmet but LSP flavoured.
  • basedpyright – Based Python. Good Python.
  • black – Drunk uncle as a code formatter. Sometimes correct, always argumentative.
  • isort – import sort as ...
  • ltex-ls-plus – Local grammar snob. Hate it, can’t live without it though.
  • clangd – C LSP. No drama. 5/5 star.
  • stylua – Side effect of chronic nvim config exposure.
  • GNU Make – Recipes for bin executables.
  • Hugo – Static site generator. Not fashion designer.
  • pandoc – Rosetta stone for markdown languages.
  • entr – Run. Big Brother is watching.

Mens - The Mind

  • pamixer – Sound through the terminal.
  • ripgrep – grep but rusty and fast.
  • bat – cat with wings.
  • fzf – Whatchamacallit.
  • fd – find, written by and for grass-touchers.
  • zoxide – A standard cd has a storage capacity of 700 megabytes.
  • yazi – Terminal file manager. Terminal vim addict.
  • lazygit – Pre shredded cheese.
  • zsh – Shell. Middle aged. Buying a Ferrari.
  • kitty – psss psss psss.
  • Oh My Posh – Pinterest inspired shell prompts.

Faciem - The Face

  • iwgtk – NetworkManager’s asian cousin.
  • Zotero – Prof. Research, Univ. Internet.
  • Inkscape – Does not improve drawing skills.
  • VLC – Popcorn, butter and salt.
  • zathura – PDF viewer for apotheosis.
  • Thunar – File Manager. Salaryman.
  • Firefox – Window to the world.
  • KDE Connect – Apple’s ecosystem, but better.
